newsitem.title: POLAND: BRE issues warrants for two listed firms. [CORRECTED 14:28 GMT]
newsitem.headline: BRE issues warrants for two listed firms. [CORRECTED 14:28 GMT]

text.p: Polish Bank Rozwoju Eksportu SA (BRE) issued call warrants for shares in the industrial and trading conglomerate Elektrim and the steel trader Stalexport shares, BRE analyst said (corrects to make clear it is BRE bank, not brokerage, which is issuing the warrants).
Dariusz Gatarek, responsible for the issue, told Reuters on Tuesday BRE had issued 30 six-month and 30 12-month warrants for Elektrim, and 30 six-month and 30 12-month warrants for Stalexport.
"The issue was yesterday and now we are quoting (the warrants) on the secondary market..so far we did not sell many (of the warrants)," he said, but did not give details.
Each warrant can be exchanged for the value of 1,000 shares, Gatarek said.

By the expiration date of August 7, 1997 holders of the six-months warrant would be entitled to buy Elektrim shares at 35 zlotys and by February 4, 1998 holders of the 12-month warrant will be able to buy it for 38 zlotys.
On Monday Elektrim traded at 33 zlotys.
By August 7, 1997 holders of the six-month Stalexport warrant would be able to the firms' shares for 39 zlotys and holders of 12-month Stalexport warrant will be able to buy the shares at 43 zlotys.
Stalexport traded at 39.5 zlotys on Monday.
Gaterek said investors were paying a 15-percent premium in case of six-month warrants and a 20 percent premium for 12-month warrants.
